page.title: 20BICESTER'S POLLUTION
page.content: As in any market town,the problem of rubbish dropped in the streets is particularly acute after Market Day (Friday).Bicester stream is often pollutth empty take-away containers and Tesco trollies. Bicester is surrounded by open fields. A wide variety of birds is found in the town as well as foxes, rabbits, rodents and other forms of wildlife. Being an old town,Bicester contains many buildings dating from the seventeenth century.These have preservation orders on them and several have recently undergone cleaning to remove black deposits caused by air pollution and traffic.The large number of roadworks currently in the town centre have greatly increased the dust and noise pollution.
